revised_title: Discovery and Properties of a Solid Compound of Iodine and Oxygene
tldr: Sir Humphry Davy discovers a new compound of iodine and oxygene and explores its properties and chemical agencies. The compound is soluble in water, has a strong astringent taste, and can undergo decomposition at specific temperatures. It also reacts with various acids, alkalies, and metallic oxides, forming new compounds and precipitates.
